page.title: 10MARTELLO TOWERS
page.content: The Martello Towers in Clacton serve as a real reminder of the uncertain history of the town and the surrounding stretch of coastline. They were used as lookout posts, and machine-gun placements during the Second World War, but their history goes back long before that. When Napoleon was threatening to overpower the rest of Europe, the Martello towers ( named after their originator ) were built along the coastline facing South, and therefore vulnerable. In reality they proved to be unnecessary, but many are well preserved today. One Martello Tower in Clacton is today used as a coastguard station, a photo of which is included in this information.
